claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table showing clinical trial results in adults 18–49 years comparing the Flublok vaccine (recombinant influenza vaccine) versus saline placebo, with numbers of cases, rates (%) of illness by matched vaccine strains and any strains, and vaccine efficacy percentages with 95% confidence intervals. This table provides efficacy data for a recombinant (insect cell–derived) influenza vaccine compared to placebo and does not mention egg- or cell-based production mutations or their impact on effectiveness, so it does not support the claim. Note: The image is clear and fully legible; no relevant information on vaccine production mutations is present.
